meanings.definition: Something that is very ugly or unpleasant to look at.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was an eyesore in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti-covered wall was such an eyesore.
meanings.sent3: The bright pink house stood out like an eyesore among the other homes.
meanings.sent4: The old, rusted car in the yard was an eyesore, reminding everyone of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The broken window was an eyesore, drawing attention away from the beautiful garden.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very unattractive or unpleasant to see.
meanings.sent1: The dilapidated statue in the park was an eyesore.
meanings.sent2: The litter scattered around the park was such an eyesore.
meanings.sent3: The bright orange outfit was an eyesore at the formal event.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned factory was an eyesore, a stark reminder of better days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The broken swing set was an eyesore, contrasting with the vibrant playground.
